note: The emperors from Tiberius to Nero have also been treated in scholarly biographies: B.M. Levick, Tiberius the Politician (1976) and R. Seager, Tiberius (1972), J.P.V.D. Balsdon, The Emperor Gaius
title: The Architect o f the Roman Empire (2 vols., 1928-31) who gives very full references to the original sources in the course of a sensitive and perceptive narrative. The period AD 14-68 is covered in A. Garzetti, From Tiberius to the Antonines
a solid narrative with extensive biblio­ graphy
A.D. Momigliano Claudius: the Emperor and his Achievement
The role of the emperor is explored at length in F. Millar, The Emperor in the Roman World

note: contains much of importance for the society and economy of the Augustan age.
title: is an excellent case-study of one member of the imperial elite, full of insights into the period as a whole
